intro: Primula florindae, commonly known as the velvetleaf primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Primula florindae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
